title: Rebrand frontend UI + metadata to “Yono Store”

requirements.summary: Update all visible site branding text in the frontend shell to “Yono Store”.
acceptanceCriteria: The primary visible site branding text reads "Yono Store" on public pages.
The primary visible site branding text reads "Yono Store" in the admin area (if admin UI has a header/title).
No user-facing site branding strings show the old/placeholder name.

file_operations.description: Ensure the app shell displays the brand name “Yono Store” in the static HTML (e.g., a minimal non-React brand/header label above the root mount) so it is consistently visible regardless of route (including any admin views rendered inside the app). Also scan/replace any placeholder product/site name strings in this file with “Yono Store”.

requirements.summary: Set default HTML document metadata (at minimum: title) to “Yono Store”.
acceptanceCriteria: The browser tab title defaults to "Yono Store" on initial load.
Routes that do not override page metadata still show "Yono Store" as the base title.

file_operations.description: Set/confirm the default document <title> is exactly “Yono Store”, and add/update any basic, route-agnostic metadata in the static HTML head (as applicable) so the base title remains “Yono Store” unless explicitly overridden by the app.

requirements.summary: Update any user-facing onboarding/help text in the frontend shell to reference “Yono Store”.
acceptanceCriteria: Any user-facing documentation pages or visible help text (if present) reference "Yono Store" and not a placeholder name.

file_operations.description: Review any user-visible fallback/help/onboarding text present in the static HTML (e.g., noscript messaging or any inline explanatory text) and ensure it references the site as “Yono Store” with no placeholder/old branding.
